templates.name: Oracle Cloud Compute by HTTP
templates.description:
This template monitors Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) single compute instance resources and discovers attached
virtual network interface cards (VNICs) and monitors their resources.

This template is not meant to be used independently, but together with Oracle Cloud by HTTP as a template for
LLD host prototypes.

Read the template documentation prior to using this template.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Get instance availability
items.description: The accessibility status of a virtual machine instance. A value of "1" indicates that the instance is unresponsive due to an issue with the infrastructure or the instance itself. A value of "0" indicates that an accessibility issue has not been detected. If the instance is stopped, then the metric does not have a value.

items.name: CPU utilization, in %
items.description: Activity level from the CPU. Expressed as a percentage of the total time.

triggers.name: Current CPU utilization is high
triggers.description: Current CPU utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.COMPUTE.CPU.UTIL.WARN}`% of the max available value.

dependencies.name: Current CPU utilization is too high

triggers.name: Current CPU utilization is too high
triggers.event_name: Current CPU utilization is too high (util >= {$OCI.COMPUTE.CPU.UTIL.HIGH}%)
triggers.description: Current CPU utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.COMPUTE.CPU.UTIL.HIGH}`% of the max available value.

items.name: Disk read I/O
items.description: Activity level from I/O reads. Expressed as reads per interval.

items.name: Disk write I/O
items.description: Activity level from I/O writes. Expressed as writes per interval.

items.name: Disk bytes read
items.description: Read throughput. Expressed as bytes read per interval.

items.name: Disk bytes written
items.description: Write throughput. Expressed as bytes written per interval.

items.name: Load average
items.description: Average system load calculated over a 1-minute period. Expressed as a number of processes.

items.name: Memory allocation stalls
items.description: Number of times page reclaim was called directly.

items.name: Memory utilization, in %
items.description: Space currently in use, measured in pages. Expressed as a percentage of used pages.

triggers.name: Current memory utilization is high
triggers.description: Current memory utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.COMPUTE.MEM.UTIL.WARN}`% of the max available value.

dependencies.name: Current memory utilization is too high

triggers.name: Current memory utilization is too high
triggers.event_name: Current memory utilization is too high (util >= {$OCI.COMPUTE.MEM.UTIL.HIGH}%)
triggers.description: Current memory utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.COMPUTE.MEM.UTIL.HIGH}`% of the max available value.

items.name: Get compute metrics
Network bytes in
items.description: Network bytes in for the compute instance.

items.name: Network bytes out
items.description: Network bytes out for the compute instance.

items.name: State
items.description: The current state of the instance.

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Compute by HTTP/oci.compute.state.get,#1)<>last(/Oracle Cloud Compute by HTTP/oci.compute.state.get,#2)
triggers.name: State has changed

items.name: Get VNICs
items.description: Gets information about all virtual network interface cards attached to the instance.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Attachment state
item_prototypes.description: Current attachment state of the VNIC.

trigger_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: VNIC is not attached
trigger_prototypes.description: Virtual network interface card attachment status.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Egress packets dropped by security list
item_prototypes.description: Packets sent by the VNIC, destined for the network, dropped due to security rule violations.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Smartnic buffer drops from host
item_prototypes.description: Number of packets dropped in SmartNIC from the host due to buffer exhaustion. This metric is available only for Bare Metal Instances. For virtual machines, these metric values are zero.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Ingress packets dropped by security list
item_prototypes.description: Packets received from the network, destined for the VNIC, dropped due to security rule violations.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Get metrics
item_prototypes.description: Gets virtual network interface card metrics.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Bytes to network
item_prototypes.description: Bytes sent from the VNIC to the network, before drops.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Bytes from network
item_prototypes.description: Bytes received at the VNIC from the network, after drops.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Connection tracking table full
item_prototypes.description: Boolean (0/false, 1/true) that indicates the connection tracking table is full.

trigger_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Conntrack table full
trigger_prototypes.description: Virtual network interface card connection tracking table is full.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Connection tracking table utilization, in %
item_prototypes.description: Total utilization percentage (0-100%) of the connection tracking table.

trigger_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Current conntrack table utilization is high
trigger_prototypes.event_name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Current conntrack table utilization is high (util >= {$OCI.COMPUTE.VNIC.CONNTRACK.UTIL.WARN}%)
trigger_prototypes.description: Current conntrack table utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.COMPUTE.VNIC.CONNTRACK.UTIL.WARN}`% of the max available value.

dependencies.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Current conntrack table utilization is too high

trigger_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Current conntrack table utilization is too high
trigger_prototypes.event_name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Current conntrack table utilization is too high (util >= {$OCI.COMPUTE.VNIC.CONNTRACK.UTIL.HIGH}%)
trigger_prototypes.description: Current conntrack table utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.COMPUTE.VNIC.CONNTRACK.UTIL.HIGH}`% of the max available value.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Egress packets dropped by full connection tracking table
item_prototypes.description: Packets sent from the VNIC, destined for the network, dropped due to the full connection tracking table.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Throttled egress packets
item_prototypes.description: Packets sent from the VNIC, destined for the network, dropped due to throttling.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Packets to network
item_prototypes.description: Packets sent from the VNIC to the network, before drops.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Ingress packets dropped by full connection tracking table
item_prototypes.description: Packets received from the network, destined for the VNIC, dropped due to the full connection tracking table.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Throttled ingress packets
item_prototypes.description: Packets received from the network, destined for the VNIC, dropped due to throttling.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Packets from network
item_prototypes.description: Packets received at the VNIC from the network, after drops.

item_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Smartnic buffer drops from network
item_prototypes.description: Number of packets dropped in SmartNIC from the network due to buffer exhaustion. This metric is available only for Bare Metal Instances. For virtual machines, these metric values are zero.

graph_prototypes.name: VNIC [{#NAME}]: Network packets dropped by connection tracking table
VNIC [{#NAME}]: Network packets dropped by security list

macros.description: Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "high" severity event about CPU resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "warning" severity event about CPU resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "high" severity event about memory resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "warning" severity event about memory resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "high" severity event about VNIC connection tracking table utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "warning" severity event about VNIC connection tracking table utilization.
Sets the regex string of VNIC names to allow in discovery.
Sets the regex string of VNIC names to ignore in discovery.
Sets the regex string of VNIC states to allow in discovery.
Sets the regex string of VNIC states to ignore in discovery.
Set an HTTP proxy for OCI API requests if needed.
Set the HTTP return code that represents an OK response from the API. The default is "200",  but can vary, for example, if a proxy is used.

OCI Compute: Disk bytes write I/O
